text: 第1話 第1
translation: Episode 1, Part 1

text: 中部全域に特別非常事態宣言が発令されました
translation: A special state of emergency has been declared for the entire Chubu region.
grammar: Formal announcement style using passive form されました

text: 住民の方々は速やかに指定のシェルターへ避難してください
translation: Residents are asked to evacuate promptly to designated shelters.
grammar: Formal request using てください

text: 繰り返しお伝えいたします / 本日12時30分
translation: We repeat: Today at 12:30 PM
grammar: Very formal/humble language with お~いたします construction

text: 東海地方を中心とした関東中部全域に特別非常事態宣言が発令されました
translation: A special state of emergency has been declared for the entire Kanto-Chubu region centered on the Tokai area.
grammar: を中心とした = centered on, focusing on

text: 住民の方々は速やかに / よりによってこんな時に見失うだなんて
translation: Residents should promptly... / Of all times to lose sight of him!
grammar: Casual speech interrupting formal announcement; だなんて emphasizes disbelief/frustration

text: 参ったね
translation: This is bad.

vocabulary.meaning: to be troubled, to be stumped

grammar: Casual masculine speech with ね for light emphasis

text: 特別非常事態宣言発令のため現在全ての通常回線は普通となっております
translation: Due to the special emergency declaration, all regular lines are currently unavailable.
grammar: となっております = formal ongoing state (note: likely means 不通 'out of service' not 普通 'normal')

text: ダメか / やっぱり来るんじゃなかった
translation: No good, huh? / I shouldn't have come after all.
grammar: んじゃなかった = casual regretful past (shouldn't have done)

text: 待ち合わせは無理か
translation: Meeting up is impossible, huh?
grammar: Casual masculine か for confirmation

text: しょうがないシェルターへ行こう
translation: Can't be helped. Let's go to the shelter.
grammar: Casual volitional form 行こう; no pause/punctuation between phrases

text: 正体不明の移動物体は、以前本書に対し進行中。 / 目標を映像で確認。下モニターに回します。
translation: An unidentified moving object is currently advancing toward this city as before. / Confirming target on video. Transferring to lower monitor.
grammar: Military communication style with clipped sentences

text: 15年ぶりだね。 / ああ、間違いない。
translation: It's been 15 years, hasn't it? / Yeah, no mistake.
grammar: ぶり indicates time elapsed since last occurrence

text: 使徒だ。
translation: It's an Angel.

text: 目標に前段命中!
translation: Direct hit on target!
grammar: Military jargon

text: ごめん、お待たせ
translation: Sorry, kept you waiting.
grammar: Casual speech; お待たせ is shortened from お待たせしました

text: 目標は依然健在だ 現在も第三進東京市に向かい進行中 / 航空隊の戦力では足止めできません
translation: Target is still intact. Currently continuing to advance toward New Tokyo-3. / The air force's strength is insufficient to stop it.

vocabulary.reading: だいさんしんとうきょうし

grammar: Military report style

text: 総力戦だ 厚木とイルマも全部上げろ
translation: It's all-out war. Launch everything from Atsugi and Iruma too.
grammar: Command form 上げろ (masculine/military)

text: 出し惜しみはなしだ 何としても目標をつぶせ!
translation: No holding back! Crush the target at all costs!

vocabulary.meaning: at all costs, by any means

grammar: Command form せ; はなしだ = no doing X

text: なんでだ!直撃のはずだ! / 戦車代替は壊滅。誘導兵器も砲爆撃もまるで効果なしか! / ダメだ!この程度の火力ではなっちがあかん!
translation: Why!? It should have been a direct hit! / Tank units are annihilated. Guided weapons and artillery bombardment have no effect at all! / It's no use! This level of firepower won't cut it!
grammar: なっちがあかん is Kansai dialect for どうにもならない

text: やはりATフィールドか? / ああ。首都に対し通常兵器では役に立たないよ。
translation: So it's an AT Field after all? / Yeah. Conventional weapons are useless against them.
grammar: に対し = against, toward

text: わかりました。予定通り発動いたします。
translation: Understood. We will proceed as planned.
grammar: いたします = humble form of する

text: ちょっとまさか、N2地雷を使うわけ!?
translation: Wait, you can't mean you're going to use N2 mines!?
grammar: わけ!? = you mean/intend to...!? (surprised question)

text: 捨てて!
translation: Get down!
grammar: Command form using て-form (urgent)

text: やった! / 残念ながら君たちの出番はなかったようだな / 衝撃波、来ます。
translation: We did it! / Unfortunately, it seems your turn never came. / Shockwave incoming.
grammar: ようだな = it seems (masculine casual)

text: 大丈夫だった? / ええ。口の中がシャリシャリしますけど。
translation: Are you okay? / Yes. Though my mouth feels gritty.
grammar: けど at end = but/though (softening statement)

text: そいつは結構。じゃあ、行くわよ。
translation: That's good. Well then, let's go.
grammar: わよ = feminine sentence ending for assertion

text: せーの!
translation: On three! / Heave-ho!

text: どうもありがとう。助かったわ。 / いや、僕の方かさ。桂木さん。 / ミサトでいいわよ
translation: Thank you very much. You saved me. / No, I'm the one who should thank you, Katsuragi-san. / Just call me Misato.
grammar: 方 = the one (who); でいい = X is fine/acceptable

text: 改めてよろしくね / イカリシンジ君
translation: Nice to meet you again. / Ikari Shinji-kun.

vocabulary.meaning: please treat me well, nice to meet you

text: はい / その後の目標は? / 電波障害のため確認できません
translation: Yes. / Status of the target? / Cannot confirm due to radio interference.
grammar: ため = due to, because of

text: あの爆発だ / ケリはついている / センサー回復します
translation: That explosion... / It's finished. / Sensors recovering.
grammar: ケリがつく = to be settled/concluded

text: 爆心時にエネルギー反応 / 何だと? / 映像回復します
translation: Energy reaction at the blast center! / What!? / Video recovering.
grammar: 何だと = what!? (shocked/masculine); に = at/in (location/time)

text: 我々の切り札が
translation: Our trump card...

vocabulary.meaning: trump card, ace up one's sleeve

grammar: Sentence fragment ending with が suggests shock/dismay at what happened to their trump card (N2 mine)

text: なんてことだ / バケモノめ
translation: What the hell... / Damn monster...

vocabulary.meaning: what the hell, good grief (expressing shock)

grammar: め is a derogatory suffix attached to nouns to express contempt or anger

text: ええ心配ご無用 / 彼は最優先で保護してるわよ / だからカートレインを用意しといて / 直通のやつ
translation: Yes, don't worry / I've got him under top priority protection / So prepare a car-train for me / The direct one
grammar: といて is casual contraction of ておいて (prepare in advance); わよ is feminine assertive ending

text: そう
translation: Right

text: 迎えに行くのは私が言い出したことですもの / ちゃんと責任持つわよ
translation: Going to pick him up was my idea / I'll take proper responsibility

vocabulary.meaning: to propose, to suggest, to bring up

grammar: ですもの is a feminine way to emphasize reason/explanation; わよ is feminine assertive

text: じゃ
translation: Well then
grammar: Casual contraction of じゃあ (well then, bye)

text: しっかしもう罪程 せっかくレストアしたばっかだったのに早くもベッコベコ
translation: Geez, what a sin though... I just restored it and it's already all beat up

vocabulary.meaning: however, geez (casual contraction of しかし)
just, only (casual form of ばかり)

grammar: ばっか is casual form of ばかり; のに expresses disappointment (even though); べっこべこ is reduplicative onomatopoeia

text: ローンがあと33回プラス修理費か おまけに一丁らの服まで大なし
translation: 33 more loan payments plus repair costs... And on top of that my best outfit is totally ruined

vocabulary.meaning: on top of that, to make matters worse

grammar: か at end shows self-reflection; まで emphasizes extent (even my clothes)

text: あの せっかく気合い入れてきたのに
translation: Um... Even though I got all psyched up for this...

vocabulary.meaning: to psych oneself up, to get fired up

grammar: のに expresses disappointment/contrary to expectation; てきた shows action completed before coming

text: あの みさとさん / なに いいんですか
translation: Um, Misato-san / What? Is it okay?
grammar: んですか is explanatory/seeking confirmation (is it really okay?)

text: こんなことして / ああいいのいいの今は非常時だし車動かなきゃしょうがないでしょ
translation: Doing something like this... / Oh it's fine, it's fine. It's an emergency and if the car won't move there's nothing we can do, right?

vocabulary.meaning: if it won't move (contraction of 動かなければ)

grammar: いいのいいの is casual repetition for emphasis; なきゃ is contraction of なければ; だし gives reason; でしょ seeks agreement

text: それに私こう見えても国際公務員ですね万事オッケーよ
translation: Besides, I may not look it, but I'm an international civil servant, so everything's A-OK

vocabulary.meaning: I may not look it, but...

grammar: こう見えても is set phrase meaning 'I may not look it but'; ですね is false start/filler before continuing

text: 説得力に欠ける言い訳ですね / つまんないの可愛い顔して意外と落ち着いてんのね
translation: That's not a very convincing excuse / How boring. You're surprisingly calm for having such a cute face

vocabulary.meaning: boring, dull (contraction of つまらない)
to calm down, to be calm

grammar: てんのね is contraction of ているのね (surprised observation); の is feminine particle

text: そうですか / あれ怒った
translation: Is that so? / Oh, did I make you mad?
grammar: あれ expresses surprise; past tense 怒った implies sudden realization

text: ごめんごめん男の子だもんね / 美里さんこそ年のわりに子供っぽい人ですね。
translation: Sorry, sorry. You're a boy after all / Misato-san is the one who's childish for her age

vocabulary.meaning: after all, because (casual, もの + ね)

grammar: だもんね is casual contraction of だものね (explanatory); こそ emphasizes contrast; っぽい suffix means '-like'

text: 予想通り事故修復中か
translation: Self-repair in progress, as expected
grammar: 中 indicates ongoing action; か is reflective particle (I see...)

text: そうでなければ単独兵器として役に立たんよ
translation: Otherwise it wouldn't be useful as an autonomous weapon

vocabulary.meaning: won't stand/be useful (contraction of 立たない)

grammar: 立たん is contraction of 立たない; よ is masculine assertive ending

text: 大したものだ機能増幅まで可能なのか
translation: Impressive. So it can even amplify its functions?
grammar: まで emphasizes extent (even); のか seeks confirmation with surprise

text: おまけに知恵もついたようだ / 再度進行は時間の問題だな
translation: And on top of that, it seems to have gained intelligence / It resuming its advance is just a matter of time
grammar: ようだ expresses conjecture based on evidence; な is masculine confirmatory ending

text: この機関NERV? / そう 国連直属の飛行回送式
translation: This organization, NERV? / That's right, a special agency directly under the UN
grammar: Note: Audio appears to say 飛行回送式 but likely meant 特務機関 (special agency)

text: 父のいるところですね / まあね お父さんの仕事を知ってる?
translation: The place where my father is / Well yeah. Do you know what your father does?
grammar: ところ here means 'place'; てる is contraction of ている (do you know?)

text: 人類を守る大事な仕事だと先生からは聞いてます
translation: I've heard from my teacher that it's important work protecting humanity
grammar: からは emphasizes source; てます is polite progressive form (have heard/been told)

text: 今から本作戦の指揮権は君に移った
translation: From now on, command authority for this operation has been transferred to you
grammar: 今から marks starting point; に marks recipient of transfer

text: 碇君我々の所有兵器では目標に対し有効な手段がないことは認めようだが君なら勝てるのかねそのためのNERVです期待してるよ
translation: Ikari-kun, I'll admit we have no effective means against the target with our weapons, but can you win? / NERV exists for that purpose. We're counting on you
grammar: ようだが is formal concessive (I'll admit...but); のかね seeks answer (can you?); そのための means 'for that purpose'; てるよ is casual progressive

text: 目標はいまだ変化なし現在迎撃システム稼働率7.5%国連軍もお手上げかどうするつもりだ初号機を起動させる初号機をかパイロットがいないぞ問題ないもう一人の予備が届く
translation: Target still unchanged. Current interception system operational rate 7.5%. Even the UN forces are helpless. What do you intend to do? / Activate Unit-01. / Unit-01? There's no pilot! / No problem. The other spare will arrive
grammar: Military/technical jargon; rapid-fire dialogue with minimal particles (emergency situation speech pattern)

text: これから父のところへ行くんですか
translation: Are we going to my father's place now?
grammar: んですか is explanatory question form (seeking explanation/confirmation)

text: そうねそうなるわね
translation: I suppose so. That's how it'll turn out

vocabulary.meaning: to become so, to turn out that way

grammar: わね is feminine particle showing agreement/contemplation

text: 父さん
translation: Father...
grammar: Murmured reflection; Shinji thinking about his father

text: あそうだお父さんからIDもらってない
translation: Oh right, you haven't gotten your ID card from your father
grammar: てない is casual negative progressive (haven't received); あ shows sudden realization

text: はい
translation: Yes

text: どうぞ / ありがとう
translation: Here you go / Thank you

text: じゃあこれ読んどいてね
translation: Well then, read this (in the meantime), okay?

vocabulary.meaning: read (and keep it in mind) - contraction of 読んでおいて

grammar: んどいて is contraction of んでおいて (do in advance/preparation); ね seeks acknowledgment

text: この仕事…なんかするんですか?僕が…
translation: This work... Am I supposed to do something? Me...?
grammar: んですか is explanatory question (seeking confirmation); hesitant speech pattern with ellipses shows uncertainty

text: そうですね…用もないのに父が僕に手紙をくれるはず…ないですよね / そっか…苦手なのね、お父さんが
translation: That's right... There's no way my father would send me a letter without some reason, right? / I see... you're not good with your father.
grammar: Uses ~はずない to express 'there's no way/it's impossible that'. Casual speech with contracted そっか (そうか).

text: あたしと同じね
translation: Just like me.
grammar: Casual feminine speech. あたし is a casual feminine first-person pronoun.

text: すごい!
translation: Amazing!

text: ほんとに血をフロントだ!
translation: It's really an underground fortress!

vocabulary.meaning: really; truly (casual form of 本当に)

grammar: Casual speech with ほんとに (shortened form of 本当に).

text: 世界再建の要、人類の砦となるところよ。
translation: It's the linchpin of rebuilding the world, a fortress for humanity.
grammar: Formal explanation using の to link nouns and となる meaning 'to become/serve as'.

text: おかしいなぁ。 / 確かこの道のはずよね。
translation: That's strange. / This should definitely be the right way.

vocabulary.meaning: certainly; surely; if I remember correctly

grammar: Uses はず to express expectation. よね seeks confirmation.

text: セントラルドゴムの閉鎖通路は、 / ゲードからスカート開きづらいのよね、ここ。
translation: The closed passages in Central Dogma... / The gate card doesn't open easily here, you know.
grammar: ~づらい means 'difficult to ~'. Technical jargon: Central Dogma, gate card.

text: しかしリツコはどこ行っちゃったのかしら。 / ごめんね。まだ慣れてなくって。
translation: But I wonder where Ritsuko went. / Sorry. I'm still not used to it yet.

vocabulary.meaning: went (casual contraction of 行ってしまった)
to get used to; to become accustomed

grammar: Casual contractions: 行っちゃった (行ってしまった), なくって (なくて). かしら is feminine wondering.

text: さっき通りましたよ、ここ。
translation: We passed through here just now.

text: でも大丈夫 システムは利用するためにあるものね
translation: But it's okay. Systems exist to be used, right?
grammar: ~ためにある means 'exists for the purpose of ~'.

text: 技術局一課 イー計画担当の赤城律子博士
translation: Dr. Ritsuko Akagi of Technical Division One, in charge of the E-Project.
grammar: Formal organizational titles and structure.

text: 赤城律子博士 支給作戦部第一課 桂木みさと一位までご連絡ください / あきれた また迷ったのね
translation: Dr. Ritsuko Akagi, please contact Captain Misato Katsuragi of Operations Division One. / Good grief. You got lost again, didn't you?

vocabulary.meaning: to get lost; to lose one's way

grammar: Formal PA announcement followed by casual scolding. のね seeks confirmation with slight exasperation.

text: あら 律子
translation: Oh, Ritsuko.
grammar: Feminine casual interjection.

text: 何やってたの? / カツラギイチ / 人でもなければ時間もないのよ / ごめん
translation: What were you doing? / Captain Katsuragi. / We don't have the people or the time. / Sorry.
grammar: ~もなければ~もない pattern means 'neither ~ nor ~'.

text: 例の男の子ね / そう / マルドゥックの報告書による
translation: The boy in question, right? / Yes. / According to the Marduk report.
grammar: 例の means 'the aforementioned/that particular'. による means 'according to'.

text: サードチルドレン / よろしくね / はい / これまた父親そっくりなのよ / 可愛げのないところとかね
translation: Third Children. / Nice to meet you. / Yes. / He's just like his father. / Like the part where he has no charm.

vocabulary.meaning: nice to meet you; please treat me well

grammar: そっくり means 'exactly like'. とか means 'like/such as'. げ suffix creates noun meaning quality of being ~.

text: 頼む
translation: I'm counting on you.

vocabulary.meaning: to request; to count on; I'm counting on you

grammar: Short command/request form, commonly used in military/business contexts.

text: 3年ぶりの対面か
translation: A reunion after three years, I suppose.

vocabulary.meaning: after (duration); for the first time in

grammar: ~ぶり means 'for the first time in ~'. か indicates contemplation/wondering.

text: 副司令 / 目標が再び移動を始めました
translation: Vice Commander. / The target has begun moving again.
grammar: Military jargon and formal reporting style.

text: よし / 総員第一種戦闘配置 / 繰り返す総員第一種戦闘配置 / 対地迎撃戦用意 / ですって / これは一大事ね
translation: Alright. / All hands, Level One Battle Stations. / Repeat, all hands, Level One Battle Stations. / Prepare for ground intercept battle. / That's what they said? / This is a major crisis.

vocabulary.meaning: did they say?; I heard that

grammar: Military commands and announcements. ですって is hearsay/quotation marker.

text: で、初号機はどうなの? / B型装備のまま現在冷却中
translation: So, how's Unit-01? / Currently cooling down with Type-B equipment still on.
grammar: のまま means 'in the state of ~'. ~中 means 'in the middle of ~ing'.

text: まだ一度も動いたことないんでしょ 起動確率は0.00000001%
translation: It's never moved even once, right? Activation probability is 0.00000001%.
grammar: ~たことない means 'have never ~ed'. んでしょ is casual confirmation-seeking (のでしょう).

text: オーナインシステムとはよく言ったものだ それって動かないってことあら失礼ね
translation: They sure named it well - the 'O-Nine System.' So that means it doesn't work? Oh, how rude.
grammar: とはよく言ったものだ is idiomatic for 'aptly/well named'. ~ってこと is casual quotative.

text: 0ではなくてよ数字の上ではね まどの道動きませんでしたではもう済まされないわ
translation: It's not zero, you know. On paper, at least. We can't get away with 'it didn't move again' anymore.

vocabulary.meaning: to finish; to get away with

grammar: ~の上では means 'on/in terms of ~'. ~では済まされない means 'can't get away with/be excused by ~'.

text: 真っ暗ですよ
translation: It's pitch dark.
grammar: 真っ~ prefix intensifies adjectives meaning 'completely/totally'.

text: 顔? / 巨大ロボット?
translation: A face? / A giant robot?

text: 探しても乗ってないわよ / 人の作り出した究極の汎用人型決戦兵器 / 人造人間エヴァンゲリオン
translation: You won't find it even if you search. / The ultimate multi-purpose humanoid decisive weapon created by mankind. / Artificial Human Evangelion.
grammar: Technical/military terminology. ~ても means 'even if ~'.

text: その初号機 / 剣像は極秘利で行われた。我々人類、最後の切り札よ。
translation: That's Unit-01. / Construction was carried out in absolute secrecy. It's humanity's last trump card.
grammar: ~で行われた passive form 'was carried out at/in ~'. Dramatic reveal using よ.

text: これも父の仕事ですか? / そうだ。
translation: Is this also my father's work? / That's right.

text: 久しぶりだな。
translation: It's been a while.

vocabulary.meaning: long time no see; it's been a while

grammar: Masculine casual speech with だな.

text: 父さん。
translation: Father.

text: 出撃。 / 出撃!?0号機は凍結中でしょ!?
translation: Sortie. / Sortie!? Unit-00 is frozen, isn't it!?
grammar: Military command. でしょ is confirmation-seeking (でしょう casual).

text: まさか、初号機を使うつもりなの!? / 他に道はないわ。 / おっと!レイはまだ動かせないでしょ!
translation: Don't tell me you intend to use Unit-01!? / There's no other way. / Wait! You still can't move Rei, can you!?
grammar: まさか expresses disbelief. ~つもり means 'intend to ~'. ~はない means 'there is no ~'.

text: パイロットがいないわよ!
translation: There's no pilot!
grammar: Casual feminine speech with わよ (emphatic particle used by women)

text: さっき届いたわ
translation: He just arrived.
grammar: Casual feminine speech with わ ending

text: マジなの? / ヒカリ・シンジ君 / はい
translation: Are you serious? / Shinji Ikari. / Yes.
grammar: マジ is casual/slang abbreviation of 真面目 (まじめ)

text: あなたが乗るのよ / でも、アヤナミ・レイでさえエヴァーとシンクロするのに7ヶ月もかかったんでしょ? / 今来たばかりのこの国はとても無理よ
translation: You're going to pilot it. / But even Ayanami Rei took 7 months to synchronize with the Eva, right? / This kid who just arrived—it's completely impossible.
grammar: んでしょ? = shortened form of のでしょう? (seeking confirmation); ばかりの = just recently; とても無理 = completely impossible

text: 座っていればいいわ、それ以上は望みません / しかし / 今は死と撃退が最優先事項です
translation: He just needs to sit there, I don't expect anything more. / But— / Right now, the Angel's defeat is our top priority.
grammar: ていればいい = just needs to do X; それ以上は = anything beyond that

text: そのためには誰であれエヴァとわずかでもシンクロ可能と思われる人間を乗せるしか方法はないわ
translation: To that end, the only option is to have anyone who seems even slightly capable of synchronizing with the Eva pilot it.

vocabulary.meaning: to put on board, to make pilot

grammar: しか〜ない = only, nothing but; 誰であれ = whoever (hypothetical); と思われる = passive form meaning 'is thought to be'

text: わかっているはずよ 桂木一位
translation: You should understand that, Captain Katsuragi.
grammar: ているはず = should understand; Military rank usage

text: そうね
translation: You're right.
grammar: Feminine ending ね showing reluctant agreement

text: 父さん なぜ呼んだの / お前の考えている通りだ
translation: Father, why did you call me here? / It's just as you're thinking.

vocabulary.meaning: you (rough, used by males to inferiors)

grammar: お前 = rough masculine pronoun showing distance/authority; 通りだ = exactly as

text: じゃあ僕がこれに乗ってさっきのと戦えっていうの
translation: So you're saying I should pilot this thing and fight that... that thing from before?
grammar: 戦えっていうの = contracted form of 戦えと言うの (you're saying I should fight); っていう = casual quotation

text: そうだ / 嫌だよそんなの / 何を今更なんだよ / 父さんは僕がやないんじゃなかったの? / 必要だから呼んだまでだ
translation: That's right. / I don't want to do that! / What are you saying now? / Didn't you not need me, Father? / I only called you because I needed you.

vocabulary.meaning: now of all times, at this late hour

grammar: んじゃなかったの = wasn't it that...?; までだ = merely, only (emphasizes limitation)

text: なぜ僕のの? / 他の人間には無理だからな
translation: Why does it have to be me? / Because it's impossible for anyone else.
grammar: 僕のの appears to be 僕なの (why me); だからな = that's why (masculine, explanatory)

text: 無理だよそんなの / 見たことも聞いたこともないのにできるわけないよ
translation: That's impossible! / There's no way I can do something I've never even seen or heard of!
grammar: 〜たこともない = have never even ~; できるわけない = there's no way I can do it; のに = despite, even though

text: 説明を受けろ / そんな
translation: Receive the briefing. / But...
grammar: 受けろ = imperative form (command); そんな = trailing off mid-protest

text: できっこないよ / こんなの乗れるわけないよ
translation: There's no way I can do it! / There's no way I can pilot this thing!
grammar: っこない = emphatic negative (absolutely can't); わけない = there's no way

text: 乗るなら早くしろ / 出なければ帰れ
translation: If you're going to pilot it, hurry up. / If not, go home.
grammar: なら〜しろ = if you're going to X, do Y (command); なければ = if not; Gendo's cold, commanding tone

text: 奴をここに気づいたか
translation: So it's noticed this place.
grammar: 〜たか = rhetorical question confirming realization

text: シンジ君時間がない
translation: Shinji, there's no time!
grammar: がない = there isn't; urgent tone

text: 乗りなさい
translation: Get in.
grammar: なさい = polite command form; Gendo's authoritative tone

text: やだよ / せっかく来たのに / こんなのないよ
translation: I don't wanna! / I came all the way here and... / This isn't fair!

vocabulary.meaning: I don't want to (casual contraction of 嫌だ)
with trouble, going to the effort

grammar: やだ = casual contraction of 嫌だ; せっかく〜のに = even though I went to the trouble of; こんなのない = this isn't right/fair

text: シンジ君 / 何のためにここに来たの
translation: Shinji. / What did you come here for?
grammar: 何のために = for what purpose; Misato's challenging question

text: ダメよ逃げちゃ / お父さんから / 何よりも自分から
translation: You mustn't run away. / Not from your father. / And most of all, not from yourself.
grammar: 逃げちゃ = contraction of 逃げては (mustn't run away); 何よりも = more than anything; Key thematic line

text: 分かってるよ / でもできるわけないよ
translation: I know that! / But there's no way I can do it!
grammar: てるよ = contraction of ている (I'm understanding/I know); でも = but; わけない = there's no way

text: 冬月
translation: Fuyutsuki.

text: レイを起こしてくれ / 使えるかね / 死んでいるわけではない
translation: Wake Rei. / Can she be used? / She's not dead.
grammar: てくれ = do for me (command); かね = questioning suffix (can she...?); わけではない = it's not that

text: わかった
translation: Understood.
grammar: Past tense of わかる used as acknowledgment of order

text: レイ
translation: Rei.

text: 予備が使えなくなった / もう一度だ / はい
translation: The backup can't be used. / One more time. / Yes.
grammar: 使えなくなった = became unable to use; Rei's injured state but still compliant

text: 初号機のシステムをレイに書き直して / 再起動!
translation: Rewrite Unit-01's system for Rei. / Restart!
grammar: 書き直して = te-form of rewrite (command to do so); Technical/military jargon

text: 了解。現作業中断。再起動に入ります。
translation: Roger. Suspending current operations. Commencing restart.
grammar: に入ります = commence/enter into; Military/technical jargon

text: やっぱり僕は、いらない人間なんだ。
translation: I knew it. I'm an unnecessary person after all.
grammar: んだ = explanatory のだ (realization); Shinji's key emotional moment of self-doubt

text: 危ない!
translation: Look out!
grammar: Exclamation warning of danger

text: エヴァが動いた!どういうことだ? / ウアンの拘束を引きちぎっています!
translation: The Eva moved! What's going on? / It's tearing through Unit-01's restraints!

vocabulary.meaning: what does this mean, what's going on
to tear off, to rip apart

grammar: どういうことだ = what's the meaning of this?; ています = ongoing action (is tearing)

text: まさか、ありえないわ / エントリープラグも挿入していないのよ / 動くはずないわ
translation: No way, that's impossible! We haven't even inserted the entry plug! It shouldn't be able to move!
grammar: わ (wa) - feminine sentence-ending particle for emphasis; 〜ていない - negative progressive form

text: インターフェイスもなしに反応している
translation: It's reacting without even an interface!
grammar: 〜なしに - without; 〜ている - progressive form indicating ongoing state

text: 逃げちゃダメだ、逃げちゃダメだ
translation: I mustn't run away, I mustn't run away
grammar: 〜ちゃダメ - contraction of 〜てはダメ meaning 'must not do'; repetition for emphasis/self-encouragement

text: やります、僕が乗ります!
translation: I'll do it, I'll pilot it!

vocabulary.meaning: to ride, to board, to pilot

text: 冷却終了。不安の再固定完了。
translation: Cooling complete. Restraint refixing complete.
grammar: Technical/military jargon with abbreviated sentence structure

text: ケージ内、全てドッキング位置。 / 停止信号プラグ、排出終了。
translation: All systems in cage at docking position. Dummy signal plug ejection complete.
grammar: Technical terminology; abbreviated sentence structure typical of operation reports

text: 了解。エントリープラン挿入。
translation: Roger. Inserting entry plug.
grammar: Technical/military jargon with verb nominalization (no subject or auxiliary verbs)

text: プラグ固定終了。第一次接続開始。
translation: Plug fixation complete. Initiating first-stage connection.
grammar: Technical terminology with abbreviated sentence structure

text: エントリープラグ注水。 / ん? / あ、何ですかこれ?
translation: Entry plug flooding. / Hm? / Ah, what is this?

text: 大丈夫。肺がLCLで満たされれば、直接血液に酸素を取り込んでくれます。
translation: It's okay. Once your lungs are filled with LCL, it will supply oxygen directly to your blood.
grammar: 〜ば conditional form; 〜てくれる - doing something for you (benefactive)

text: すぐになれるわ。
translation: You'll get used to it soon.

vocabulary.meaning: to get used to, to become accustomed

grammar: わ - feminine sentence-ending particle

text: クボス悪い。 / 我慢なさい!男の子でしょ! / ああ。
translation: It feels gross. / Put up with it! You're a boy, aren't you! / Yeah.
grammar: きもちわるい contracted to きもわるい or クボス悪い (slurred casual speech); なさい - polite imperative; でしょ - contraction of でしょう (right?)

text: 主電源接続。電解の動力伝達。 / 了解。
translation: Main power connection. Transmitting power to all circuits. / Roger.
grammar: Technical terminology with abbreviated sentence structure

text: 第二次コンタクトに入ります。 / A点神経射速、異常なし。
translation: Entering second-stage contact. / A-10 nerve connection speed, no anomalies.
grammar: Technical jargon; A点 likely refers to A-10 nerve connection point

text: 思考形態は日本語を基礎原則としてフィックス。
translation: Thought pattern fixed with Japanese as the fundamental principle.
grammar: として - as, in the capacity of; technical terminology

text: 初期コンタクト、すべて問題なし。 / 双方向回線開きます。 / シンクロ率41.3%。
translation: Initial contact, all systems normal. / Opening bilateral circuits. / Synchronization rate 41.3%.
grammar: Technical terminology; abbreviated sentence structure

text: すごいわね。ハーモニクスすべて正常地。暴走ありません。
translation: Amazing. All harmonics in normal range. No runaway detected.
grammar: わね - feminine particle showing emotion/emphasis

text: いけるわ。
translation: This will work.

vocabulary.meaning: to be good, to work, to be acceptable

grammar: わ - feminine sentence-ending particle; いける used colloquially to mean 'this is viable/workable'

text: 発進準備! / 発進準備!
translation: Prepare for launch! / Prepare for launch!
grammar: Military command; abbreviated (implied verb)

text: 第1ロックボルト発生!
translation: First lock bolt released!
grammar: Technical terminology; 発生 used to mean 'released' in this context

text: 回答確認!アンビニカルブリッジ移動開始!
translation: Response confirmed! Umbilical bridge movement initiated!

vocabulary.word: アンビリカルブリッジ
vocabulary.reading: アンビリカルブリッジ

grammar: Technical terminology; abbreviated command structure

text: 第2ロックボルト発生!
translation: Second lock bolt released!

text: 第1高速部除去。 / 同じく第2高速部除去。
translation: First restraint unit removed. / Second restraint unit removed as well.
grammar: Technical terminology; 同じく - abbreviated form expressing 'the same action'

text: エヴァ初号機、車室口へ
translation: Eva Unit-01 to launch port
grammar: Military/technical command; abbreviated (implied verb of movement)

text: 進路クリア オールグリーン / 発進準備完了
translation: Route clear, all green. Launch preparations complete.
grammar: Technical/military jargon with English loanwords

text: 了解 / 構いませんね / もちろんだ
translation: Roger. / You're sure about this? / Of course.
grammar: 構いません - 'don't mind' used here as confirmation question with ね

text: 使徒を倒さぬ限り 我々に未来はない
translation: Unless we defeat the Angel, we have no future.
grammar: 〜ぬ - archaic/literary negative form (倒さぬ = 倒さない); 〜限り - unless/as long as

text: 怒り 本当にこれでいいんだな
translation: Ikari, you're really okay with this?
grammar: 〜でいい - to be okay/acceptable; んだな - explanatory の + だ + confirmatory な

text: 発進
translation: Launch.
grammar: Single-word command

text: シンジ君 死なないでよ
translation: Shinji, don't die.
grammar: 〜ないで - negative request form; よ - emphatic particle conveying plea

text: エヴァは使徒に勝つ / だがそれは全ての始まりにすぎなかった
translation: Eva defeats the Angel. But that was merely the beginning of everything.
grammar: 〜にすぎない - nothing more than, merely; past tense narration

text: 父親から逃げるシンジ / ミサトの傲慢は自分が彼を救おうと決心させる / 次回見知らぬ天井
translation: Shinji flees from his father. Misato's pride makes her decide that she will save him. Next episode: The Unfamiliar Ceiling.
grammar: Episode preview narration style; 〜ようと決心させる - causative form 'makes (someone) decide to...'

text: この次もサービスサービス
translation: Next time, service service!
grammar: Repetition for emphasis; catchphrase from episode previews
